revised_title: Meteorological Observations at the Royal Observatory, Cape of Good Hope
tldr: This article presents a meteorological journal kept at the Royal Observatory in Cape of Good Hope from February to May 1834. The journal includes observations made using a barometer and two thermometers, taken at different times of the day. The author, Thomas Maclear, plans to compare his barometer with that of Sir John Herschel in a future communication.
